txt.en: 'I am not convinced that is as wise as it may seem.'
'No, the Dunlending are our brothers too. We have long lived together in peace here.'
Instance: Instance: The Council of Herubrand
'Good, everyone has arrived. It is time to begin.'
'I want to thank you three for saving Briant and me during the attack.'
'We would have died with my wife and father if not for your quick thinking.'
'We must find those who killed my family!'
'I would not have invited [placeholder] to the council if I thought doing so would risk our safety.'
'We must start somewhere. I agree, we should see if the guards might help point us in the right direction.'
'If those sworn to protect us went missing, that is troubling. We should discuss this with the captain.'
'We have nothing to base our suspicions on any particular people.'
'These injuries will heal, but I still live to see that this city does not fall.'
'It may be wise to speak with the guards around the city to see if they have seen suspicious activity?'
'Trouble seems to be brewing in the lower quarters of Woodhurst.'
'Are the Dunlendings there suspected to be behind this attack?'
'Not to interrupt, but do we know this [placeholder] can be trusted?'
'Given the events of late, I simply feel it is unwise to put trust in this newcomer. I meant no offence.'
'We could just as easily blame the Rohirrim.'
'Whom I'm sure are enthralled with us for letting this city become so dangerous for them.'
'Yes, my Reeve.'
'Speaking of which, do any remain, or have they all left? Is that not suspicious?'
'But, who is our enemy? We could not determine who those men were.'
'They looked like men from Woodhurst, though none of their faces were familiar...'
'Is anyone safe, if we cannot even keep the mead hall secure?'
'Enough.'
'Bickering about this will get us nowhere.'
'I want to catch whoever is behind this, but we should not jump to conclusions.'
'We will see what the guards and the captain have to say.'
'The night we were attacked, two guards stood watch outside the mead hall.'
'Yet I saw no guard assist our struggle, nor were they injured or dead outside the door.'
'Their absence is suspicious, and I am not sure the guards can be trusted.'
